title: Elective 4 NAM/TDL
content: I'm gunning for a MIDS specialization and I am opting for NLP for elective 3 and I am pretty confused between Network Analysis & Mining and Topics in Deep Learning. I would really appreciate it if any senior can please provide any insight into what the courses are like in reality or have any words of advice for me.

General word of advice: you have a TON of work in 6th semester. You have Capstone to start off with. It's also your last semester to lift your GPA (companies start coming by July end and the CGPA used is your 6th sem CGPA, which means whatever you do in the next sem is your final one that matters for placements). Since final year barely has courses, it will not affect your CGPA by much so this is officially your last effort when it comes to improving it. Additionally, you also have placement prep (which I hope you all do) to do. If you aren't looking at a job, then it's going to be your future studies which again takes up a lot of effort and time with your tests and other stuff. Add the 5 ISA system with its multiple labs and assignments, you are looking at a semester with maximum importance to your career as well as degree with multiple things you **absolutely must** do well in, but less time. 

Keeping this in mind, I'd suggest you to take up AIR and DBT. They've always known to be the easiest (AIR is always the easiest and DBT is mostly DBMS stuff) and easy to get marks in. **Do not take up the ML related ones**- atleast during my time the courses were terribly structured, the syllabus was crammed with everything, and ofc the faculty aren't qualified to teach. Besides, they also have a ton of assignments and labs and some even require you to write an IEEE format paper. Too much workload for such an important semester. If you do not want to take up DBT, people usually take up NAM as the other choice. 

This semester is all about being smart and taking the right decisions when it comes to all these things. If you're interested you can always learn these topics on your own, and 5 semesters at PES would have showed you enough examples of how experienced these professors are. Take easy electives, make your workload easier, get a better CGPA and give yourself time to focus on your placements/future studies prep/Capstone.
